meanings.definition: The act of delaying or lingering.
meanings.sent1: Her tarriance at the store made her late for the meeting.
meanings.sent2: The long line at the amusement park caused a tarriance for the visitors.
meanings.sent3: His tarriance in the candy aisle was so long, he almost missed the movie.
meanings.sent4: The tarriance of the snail on the sidewalk fascinated the children.
meanings.sent5: The tarriance of the clouds before the storm made the sky look ominous.

meanings.definition: A period of delay or waiting.
meanings.sent1: The tarriance for the bus was longer than usual today.
meanings.sent2: After the announcement, there was a tarriance before the applause started.
meanings.sent3: The tarriance for the food delivery felt like forever on an empty stomach.
meanings.sent4: The tarriance of the train departure felt like an eternity to the passengers.
meanings.sent5: The tarriance for the test results made her anxious and restless.
